# 4. Data management for the analysis

```{r}
# replacing 'Grass' in city variable with 'Pasto'

desc3 <- desc2 %>%
  mutate(
    city = case_when(
      city == "Grass" ~ "Pasto",
      TRUE ~ city)
  )

table(desc3$city, useNA = "always")

# only including female respondents and dropping 'male' and 'other' gender

desc4 <- desc3[!desc3$resp_gender %in% c("Male", "Other"), ]

## 7 observations were excluded.

#replacing infinite values (represened by NA) in 'dependency_ratio' with 0

desc4$dependency_ratio[is.na(desc4$dependency_ratio)] <- 0

#replacing NAs in score 1a to 12 with 0

desc4 <- desc4 %>%
  mutate(across(c(score1a, score1b, score2, score3, score4, score5, score6,
                  score7, score8, score9, score10, score11, score12), ~replace(., is.na(.), 0)))

```

# 9. recoding variables for analysis

```{r}
# nationality - changing it to numeric and setting Colombia as reference

table(desc4$nationality, useNA = "always")
desc4 <- desc4 %>% 
  mutate(nationality_new = case_when(nationality== "Colombia" ~ 0,
                             nationality== "Venezuela" ~ 1,
                             nationality== "Both (Colombia and Venezuela)" ~ 2
                             ))
desc4$nationality_new <- factor(desc4$nationality_new, levels = c(0:2), labels = c("Colombian", "Venezuelan", "Both"))

# city - changing it to numeric and setting Cali as reference

table(desc4$city, useNA = "always")
desc4 <- desc4 %>% 
  mutate(city_new = case_when(city== "Cali" ~ 0,
                             city== "Ipiales" ~ 1,
                             city== "Pasto" ~ 2,
                             city== "Popayan" ~ 3
                             ))
desc4$city_new <- factor(desc4$city_new, levels = c(0:3), labels = c("Cali", "Ipiales", "Pasto", "Popayan"))

# Status - changing it to numeric and setting 'Host population - Colombians' as reference

table(desc4$status, useNA = "always")
desc4 <- desc4 %>% 
  mutate(status_new = case_when(status== "Host population - Colombians" ~ 0,
                             status== "Colombian returnees" ~ 1,
                             status== "Returned Colombian refugees or migrants" ~ 1,
                             status== "Returning Colombians Other / Not applicable" ~ 1,
                             status== "Internally displaced persons" ~ 2,
                             status== "Internally displaced persons Other / Not applicable" ~ 2,
                             status== "Refugees or migrants" ~ 3,
                             status== "Refugees or migrants" ~ 3,
                             status== "Refugees or migrants" ~ 3,
                             status== "Refugees or migrants Internally displaced" ~ 3, #because the participant is Venezuelan
                             status== "Other / Not applicable" ~ 4,
                                                         ))
desc4$status_new <- factor(desc4$status_new, levels = c(0:4), labels = c("Host population â€“ Colombians", "Colombian returnees", "Internally displaced persons", "Refugees or migrants", "Other / Not applicable"))

# School level - changing it to numeric and setting No Primary School Completion as reference

table(desc4$school_level, useNA = "always")
desc4 <- desc4 %>% 
  mutate(school_level_new = case_when(school_level== "No Primary School Completion" ~ 0,
                             school_level== "Primary School Completion" ~ 1,
                             school_level== "Secondary School Completion" ~ 1,
                             ))
desc4$school_level_new <- factor(desc4$school_level_new, levels = c(0:1), labels = c("No primary school completion", "Primary school completion"))

# Depression level - categorizing phq9 score and setting 'No depression' as reference
desc4 <- desc4 %>% 
mutate(
    depression_level = case_when(
      phq9 < 1 ~ 0,
      phq9 >= 1 & phq9 <= 4 ~ 1,
      phq9 >= 5 & phq9 <= 9 ~ 2,
      phq9 >= 10 & phq9 <= 14 ~ 2,
      phq9 >= 15 & phq9 <= 19 ~ 3,
      phq9 >= 20 & phq9 <= 27 ~ 4
    )
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    depression_level = fct_recode(as.factor(depression_level),
                                  "No Depression" = "0",
                                  "Minimal" = "1",
                                  "Mild" = "2",
                                  "Moderate" = "3",
                                  "Moderately severe" = "4",
                                  "Severe" = "5")
  )

table(desc4$depression_level, useNA = "always")

```

# 12a. Using the multinom function to estimate multinomial logistic regression without adjusting for confounders for objective 1 (overall safety score as dependent variable).

```{r}
model1 <- multinom(desc4$depression_level ~ desc4$score6, data=desc4)
summary(model1)
```

## Hypothesis testing

Since the multinomial function does not report the p-values automatically, using the z-test to test the individual parameters.

```{r}
# z-scores
summary <- summary(model1)
z <- summary(model1)$coefficients/summary(model1)$standard.errors
z
```

```{r}
# 2-tailed z test p-values 
p <- (1 - pnorm(abs(z),0,1))*2
p

# Moderately severe is significant at p<.05
```

## calculating odds ratios and 95% CIs.

```{r}
# OR and CIs
tidy(model1, conf.int=TRUE, exponentiate = TRUE)

```

## 12b. Adjusting for confounders as per DAG for objective 1: resp_age, Assistance (score9), Debt (score10), Dependency ratio (dependency_ratio), Employment (score7), Financial resources (score8), Overall SRI (SRI), Refugee status (status_new)

```{r}

model2 <- multinom(depression_level ~ score6 + resp_age + score9 + score10 + dependency_ratio + score7 + score8 + SRI + status_new, data=desc4)
summary(model2)

## extract coefficients from the model, exponentiate and CI
tidy(model2, conf.int=TRUE, exponentiate = TRUE)
```

## Identifying why NaNs exist

```{r}
summary(model2)

```

##Variable 'status_new' has high coefficients. Therefore, removing the variable 'status_new' to check if it fixes the NaNs.

```{r}
model3 <- multinom(depression_level ~ score6 + resp_age + score9 + score10 + dependency_ratio + score7 + score8 + SRI, data=desc4)
summary(model3)

##NaNs are fixed.

## extract coefficients from the model, exponentiate and CI
tidy(model3, conf.int=TRUE, exponentiate = TRUE)
```

-For every one year increase in age, the odds of taking drugB vs drugA increases by 1.14 times (95% CI 1.07-1.21) after adjusting for sex.

#### 10. Compare the results between `model1` and `model2` (hint to make this easy to view, you can use the compareCoefs function from the car package).

```{r}
compareCoefs(model1, model3, zvals=TRUE, pvals=TRUE)
```

# 13a. Estimating multinomial logistic regression without adjusting for confounders for objective 2 (eight sub-domains of safety domains)

```{r}
#renaming domain6a_1 to domain6a_8

desc4 <- desc4 %>%
  rename(
    Conflict = domain6a_1,
    Discrimination = domain6a_2,
    Harassment_or_threats_or_violence = domain6a_3,
    COVID_or_other_infectious_diseases = domain6a_4,
    Arrest_or_deportation = domain6a_5,
    Kidnapping = domain6a_6,
    Theft_or_robbery = domain6a_7,
    Unsafe_housing_eviction = domain6a_8
  )

#Running Multinomial Regression without adjusting for confounders
model4 <- multinom(depression_level ~ 
                   Conflict + Discrimination + Harassment_or_threats_or_violence + COVID_or_other_infectious_diseases + Arrest_or_deportation + Kidnapping +  Theft_or_robbery + Unsafe_housing_eviction,
                   data = desc4)
summary(model4)

## extract coefficients from the model, exponentiate and CI
tidy(model4, conf.int=TRUE, exponentiate = TRUE)
```

## 13b. Adjusting for confounders as per DAG for objective 2: resp_age, Assistance (score9), Debt (score10), Dependency ratio (dependency_ratio), Employment (score7), Financial resources (score8), and Overall SRI (SRI).

```{r}
model5 <- multinom(depression_level ~ 
                   Conflict + Discrimination + Harassment_or_threats_or_violence + COVID_or_other_infectious_diseases + Arrest_or_deportation + Kidnapping +  Theft_or_robbery + Unsafe_housing_eviction + resp_age + score9 + score10 + dependency_ratio + score7 + score8 + SRI,
                   data = desc4)
summary(model5)

## extract coefficients from the model, exponentiate and CI
tidy(model5, conf.int=TRUE, exponentiate = TRUE)
```
